results.title: Two Chinese dancers
results.creator_credit: Wan-go Wen and Chinese Film Enterprises of America
results.brief_description: Miss Tai Ai-Lien presents two traditional Chinese folk dances, the Yao ceremonial prelude which is used at marriages and funerals, and a solo dance drama called ‘The Mute and the Cripple’. There is no dialogue or commentary, these presentations of little-known Chinese dances are accompanied by authentic folk music played on flute and drums.

results.title: Two brothers in Greece
results.brief_description: Looks at two Greek brothers, one who remains in the village of Peloponnesus to continue farming, thus helping his brother financially as he goes to engineering school, while the other runs a tourist boat through the Greek Isles.

results.title: Two bob mermaid
results.creator_credit: Antonia Barnard, Darlene Johnson and Core Films
results.brief_description: In this visually stunning short film set in the 1950s, a fair-skinned Aboriginal girl gains access to the local swimming pool where Aboriginal people are legally denied access (Source: Australian Screen)

results.title: Two blades of grass [excerpt]
results.creator_credit: CSIRO. Film Unit and S.T. Evans
results.brief_description: Develops the theme that Australia’s agricultural future could depend on the use of a properly fertilised legume. The role of the legume nodule in this respect and in opening up new areas is stressed. Excerpt from Title 011252.

results.title: Two bagatelles
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, ONF | NFB and Grant Munro
results.brief_description: Two short Norman McLaren films in which animation technique is employed with live actors. In the first, entitled On the Lawn, a male dancer waltzes to synthetic music. The second is a fast march, In the Backyard, accompanied by an old-fashioned calliope.

results.title: Two architects
results.creator_credit: British Aluminium Company and Ron Parks
results.brief_description: James Gowan and James Stirling discuss the design philosophy and building problems of the award-winning Department of Engineering, Leicester University. The lightly balanced tower of laboratories and offices, engineering workshops and cantilevered lecture halls were built on a difficult site to demanding functional and cost specifications.

results.title: Two-lane blacktop [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Michael S Laughlin, Universal Pictures and Monte Hellman
results.brief_description: A young driver and his mechanic in a souped-up 1955 Chevrolet, living off drag racing bets in the south west, establish a tentative relationship with a girl who tags on to them. They become involved in an indeterminate cross-country race with the middle-aged driver of a new Pontiac GTO. Like other Hellman films, Two-lane Blacktop is a genre film in which the popular elements are not exploited to satisfy audience expectations but are subverted into fresh patterns. This makes it the most determinedly original of the post-Easy Rider road movies, an existential parable which makes striking use of widescreen compositions, long takes and elliptical cuts while denying narrative tension. Instead there is the resonance of character and situation. Hellman has described the film as ‘a love story (about) … how much romance is left in a non-romantic world’, but this is implicit. Cast includes: James Taylor, Warren Oates, Laurie Bird, Dennis Wilson. Also available on VHS.

results.title: Two-colour separation studies
results.brief_description: A variety of still life, landscape and portrait studies in both red/green and orange/blue systems are accompanied by a detailed explanation by Arthur Cantrill of the process and history of the two colour separation system. Includes a simulation of the Kinemacolour process which alternated red and green frames.

Includes a simulation of the Kinemacolour process which alternated red and green frames.

results.title: Twins: matching genes
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Heather Cook
results.brief_description: Examines the progress made since 1936 when Dr Norma Ford Walker established a Twin Register: explains how fraternal and identical twins develop; shows a close examination of the placentas of twins; observes the behaviour of a set of identical twins; and concludes with a pair of identical twins separated shortly after birth reminiscing about their discovery of each other after twenty-four years. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
